result.execSummary:
The defendant Baron Von French was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443.00. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence.

--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being; to commence FORTHWITH

--4 days credit for time already served given; THIS IS A TIME SERVED SENTENCE

The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Baron Von French

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Baron Von French
Current: 1314 Laurel Ave, Janesville, WI 53548 United States  (Effective: 05-18-2022)
Prior: 145A N. Oak Street, Whitewater, WI 53190

[ml] Case called at 1:42PM
Defendant Baron Von French appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def declined eval).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant updates his mailing address to the following: 1314 Laurel Ave, Janesville, WI 53548.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.

The Defendant advises that he will be representing himself going forward.

The Court requires a $350.00 Cash Bond with no special conditions.

The Defendant advises that he wishes to proceed to Plea and Sentencing today. 

-----------------------------

The Court proceeds with Plea and Sentencing:

Right to counsel is given; the Defendant waives this right; the Court accepts this waiver and finds him competent to represent himself.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 5 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being; to commence FORTHWITH
--4 days credit for time already served given; THIS IS A TIME SERVED SENTENCE
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443.00. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence.
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

recess 2:00PM

[MK] case called at 11:23am 
Defendant Baron Bon French does not appear.  ADA Barbara Michaels appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today. 
The Court notes that the Warrant remains active.  
recess 11:23am
